page.title: 13SHEEP FARMING IN THE BLOCK.
page.content: One of the two shepherds in the block has in his care during the summer months a total of approx. 1805 sheep i.e. 700 ewes, 260 hogs, 25 rams and 820 lambs. Lambing is kept late, usually about 17th. April, since falls of snow and severe weather conditions are not unknown in March and April. There are about 2/3 clippings per year held in June (hogs) and July (ewes). Around August/September old ewes ,perhaps about 200,are sold in Kirriemuir. About 270 ewe lambs are kept for stock while the other 550 are fattened. Some of these are sold in Forfar for meat while the rest are sold for export in Lockerbie. The breed of the sheep in the block is Blackface or Blackface cross Swaledale.
